SENT.plain: Developmental venous anomalies (DVA) are congenital aberrations in the cerebral venous system reflecting failure of normal embryogenesis
They are considered the most common intracranial vascular malformation

Although they are generally regarded as benign entities, their clinical significance remains controversial--case reports do exist considering DVA to be the origin of thrombosis, cerebral ischemia, and hemorrhage
We report a 26-year-old patient suffering from thrombosis of a DVA
